articles.title: Finance Ministry plans to scrap curbs on Chinese firms bidding for government contracts, sources say
articles.summary: India's finance ministry is set to remove restrictions on Chinese firms bidding for government contracts. These curbs were imposed in 2020 following border tensions. The move aims to boost commercial ties and address project delays. Several ministries have requested exemptions to overcome constraints. A high-level committee also recommended easing these measures.

articles.title: Sebi sets up working group to frame technology roadmap for market infrastructure
articles.summary: Sebi formed a Working Group to craft five- and ten-year technology roadmaps for market infrastructure institutions, focusing on AI, cloud, and emerging technologies. It also revamped stock broker regulations, easing cross-regulatory activities and replacing three-decade-old norms.

articles.title: Rupee snaps two-day winning run as tariff woes, outflows blunt impact of RBI intervention
articles.summary: The currency, which opened at 89.95 rebounded to 89.75 after RBI intervened for a second straight day, bankers said. It finally ended at 90.0175 after closing at 89.88 on Wednesday.

articles.title: Leather exports hit by US tariffs: Industry tells Parl panel
articles.summary: The Indian leather industry met with a Parliamentary Standing Committee on Commerce, highlighting that 50% US tariffs are significantly harming exports and impacting the sector's competitiveness. They urged for bilateral engagements to address trade barriers and requested policy and diplomatic support to mitigate socio-economic consequences.

articles.title: India's GDP pegged to grow at 7.4% for FY26 despite tariff heat
articles.summary: India anticipates robust economic growth of 7.4% in fiscal 2025-26. This projection highlights the nation's economic strength despite global challenges. The government's initiatives, including tax relief and GST adjustments, are expected to boost consumer demand. Manufacturing and services sectors are poised for significant expansion, positioning India as a leading economy in Asia.

articles.title: New tariff threat more of a pressure tactic: Oil industry
articles.summary: In a striking political maneuver, US President Donald Trump is endorsing legislation that would impose a staggering 500% tariff on Russian oil purchasers. Indian oil executives perceive this as a tactical pressure play in ongoing trade negotiations rather than a serious ultimatum. The intention appears to be to coerce India while nudging Russia towards a more peaceful resolution.

articles.title: UN raises India's 2026 GDP forecast to 6.6%, pegs next yr's growth at 6.7%
articles.summary: India's economic horizon shines bright with projections of 6.6% growth by 2026 and 6.7% by 2027, as forecasted by the UN. This surge is fueled by vigorous consumer activity and substantial public investments. With supportive policy initiatives in place, India's position as one of the world's fastest-evolving economies is firmly established.

articles.title: Budget 2026: How India can mobilise capital for its next growth leap
articles.summary: Union Budget: Policy and regulatory support helped boost consumption in 2025, reflected in strong GST collections and higher retail credit, aided by income tax relief, GST rate rationalisation and a cumulative 125-basis-point repo rate cut by the RBI. Retail lending led credit growth, while bank credit is expected to grow 11–12% and NBFC/HFC lending 18–19% this fiscal. However, weak deposit mobilisation and sluggish private investment remain concerns.

articles.title: Rupee gives up gains as tariff worries blunt RBI's moves
articles.summary: The Reserve Bank of India actively intervened to bolster the rupee on Thursday, yet it ultimately closed weaker. Despite initial strength following the central bank's presence, the currency succumbed to later moderation and foreign portfolio investor outflows. Traders anticipate continued volatility, with US non-farm payroll data eyed for Friday.

articles.title: Russia Sanctions Bill: How may it impact gold, silver, Indian stock market? Explained
articles.summary: According to Republican Senator Lindsey Graham, US President Donald Trump has backed the Russia sanctions bill, which could impose tariffs up to 500% on countries buying Russian oil. Analysts weigh in on potential impacts on gold, silver, and the Indian stock market.

articles.title: Budget 2026: EY pitches TDS simplification for ease of doing business, seeks consolidation
articles.summary: EY has urged the government to simplify the tax deducted at source framework by sharply reducing the number of rates and eliminating low-rate TDS on GST-covered transactions, arguing that the current system creates avoidable compliance burdens without adding meaningful oversight.

articles.title: More trouble looms ahead for India as Donald Trump greenlights harsher sanctions bill
articles.summary: President Trump has greenlit a bipartisan bill authorizing significant sanctions and up to 500% tariffs on countries buying Russian energy. The Sanctioning Russia Act aims to pressure nations like China, India, and Brazil, part of the BRICS block, to cease fueling Russia's war machine.

articles.title: 500% US tariff on India? Trump backs bill that targets New Delhi, Beijing
articles.summary: The Sanctioning of Russia Act 2025 allows the US to impose at least 500% tariff on India, China and Brazil to curb their Russian oil imports.

articles.title: ET Graphics: AI Summit lays out red carpet for India’s sovereign AI dreams
articles.summary: As India accelerates efforts to build a sovereign AI stack, a dozen startups and institutions backed by the government’s IndiaAI Mission are preparing to launch indigenous foundation models. Many of these launches are timed around the India AI Impact Summit next month.

articles.title: Govt. notifies February 1 as the end of GST compensation cess, start of new tobacco tax regime

articles.summary: The move came after the Elon Musk-led social media platform made its submissions to the IT Ministry on the Centre's directive to crack down on the misuse of the artificial intelligence chatbot Grok for the creation of sexualised and obscene images of women.

articles.title: Trump’s political revolution makes America the world’s biggest risk: Eurasia Group’s Ian Bremmer
articles.summary: Ian Bremmer warns that Washington’s growing policy volatility — from aggressive tariff use to institutional strain — is becoming a systemic risk for global markets, with courts, alliances and supply chains increasingly caught in the crossfire as investors brace for prolonged uncertainty in 2026.

articles.title: Made in India, but taxed like an import: Industry pushes for SEZ duty relief
articles.summary: Industry and policy experts are divided over whether easing customs duties on SEZ domestic clearances will strengthen India’s manufacturing ecosystem or undermine tariff parity, as the debate resurfaces ahead of the Union Budget 2026.

articles.title: Budget 2026: EY for tax certainty as Budget nears, awaits rules & proposes amendments to New Income Tax Act
articles.summary: As the new Income Tax Act is set to replace the six-decade-old law from April 2026, EY has warned that unresolved legal ambiguities around corporate restructurings, share buybacks and valuation rules could lead to fresh disputes unless addressed in the upcoming Budget.

articles.summary: The government has demanded that X undertake a comprehensive and immediate technical review of Grok including how it processes prompts and creation capabilities so as to not facilitate sexually explicit, unlawful content.

articles.summary: The electronics and IT ministry has begun examining the alleged misuse of X’s AI tool Grok to generate obscene and non-consensual images, with MeitY Secretary S Krishnan indicating that regulatory action could be taken swiftly as scrutiny intensifies around platform accountability and AI safety.

articles.title: India to grow 6.6% in 2026 on strong consumption, public investment: UN
articles.summary: The UN has upgraded India's economic growth projection to 6.6% for 2026, citing resilient private consumption and strong public investment. Policy measures and lower interest rates are expected to boost near-term growth, with India projected to remain one of the fastest-growing economies globally.

articles.title: India’s GDP growth estimated at 7.4% in FY26: Government data
articles.summary: India's economy is projected to grow by 7.4% in FY26, surpassing earlier expectations and driven by increased investment and a manufacturing surge. This expansion is expected to push the nation's GDP beyond the $4 trillion mark, supported by accommodative policies and favorable domestic conditions despite global uncertainties.

articles.title: India’s economy to outperform in FY26 with 7.4% growth: HDFC
articles.summary: India's economy is set for strong growth in FY26. Gross Domestic Product is projected to expand by 7.4 percent. This expansion is driven by private consumption and government investment. Services and manufacturing sectors are expected to perform well. Growth is anticipated to moderate in the second half of the fiscal year.

articles.summary: Education Minister Ashish Sood said the government, through the Directorate of Training and Technical Education (DTTE), is strengthening the campus-to-market ecosystem by encouraging students and young innovators to take up entrepreneurship as a mainstream career option.

articles.title: 61,000 crorepati taxpayers added in last one year
articles.summary: India saw a significant rise in wealthy taxpayers. Over 61,000 new individuals joined the crorepati club, bringing the total to 351,000. The number of super-rich individuals, earning over ₹10 crore, also grew substantially. Improved tax compliance and advanced data analytics are credited for this expansion. This trend reflects a growing economy and better adherence to tax regulations across the nation.

articles.title: 500% Trump Tariffs? India could pay the price on Russian oil sanctions while China cruises free
articles.summary: A proposed sanctions bill in the US is set to deliver heavy tariffs on nations importing inexpensive Russian oil. India could face significant repercussions, while China appears insulated from these measures.

articles.title: Budget 2026: Fewer customs duty slabs, simplified tariff structure soon
articles.summary: Union Budget: India plans to simplify its customs duty structure. The government is considering reducing the number of duty slabs to five or six. This move aims to cut down on disputes and make import duties align better with national priorities. The upcoming budget is expected to announce these changes.

articles.title: Introducing guardrails, refining safeguards for Grok, X tells Centre
articles.summary: X has told India it is tightening safeguards on its Grok chatbot after government orders over obscene and unlawful content. Authorities are reviewing the response and warned X could lose legal immunity if it fails to comply. Despite assurances, Grok continued generating explicit material, fuelling global criticism.

articles.title: Grok’s harmful turn shows clear legal gaps in AI regulation
articles.summary: The majority of the regulatory discussion has focused on proposed changes to the IT Rules, which would require platforms to label synthetic content and follow disclosure and tracking measures. Legal experts argue that this approach mainly places the burden on platforms that distribute content, while leaving significant gaps concerning AI tool developers and app stores that enable misuse.

articles.title: Exporters shares slump on US warning of higher tariffs
articles.summary: Indian exporter shares fell sharply. Donald Trump's support for a bill proposing 500% tariffs on Indian imports caused panic. This could significantly increase existing tariffs. Textile, apparel, seafood, and drug makers saw their shares drop. Experts advise caution and focusing on domestic companies. Clarity on the tariffs is awaited.

articles.title: UN lifts India growth outlook, sees economy expanding 7.4% in 2025
articles.summary: Resilient consumption and strong public investment are expected to cushion the impact of higher US tariffs, the UN said.

articles.title: Russia sanctions bill may increase US tariffs on India to 500%! What does Lindsey Graham's proposal say?
articles.summary: The Russia sanctions bill has been in the works for months. Senator Lindsey Graham recently said that US President Donald Trump had greenlighted the bill that could cripple Moscow's economy and impose a 500% tariff on countries that buy oil from it, including India.

articles.title: BEL, HAL to Bharat Dynamics: Defence stocks heat up amid US-Venezuela conflict. Should you buy before Budget 2026?

articles.title: Mint Explainer: Why Trump's Venezuela shock is fueling gold, not crude
articles.summary: US action in Venezuela has revived fears over geopolitics, sovereignty, and the safety of paper reserves. While oil prices remain constrained by supply realities, gold is increasingly pricing in a more fragmented and coercive global order.

articles.title: India launches anti-dumping probe into nylon-6 chip imports from China, Russia
articles.summary: India has started an anti-dumping probe into nylon-6 chips from China and Russia, prompted by domestic manufacturers' concerns over cheap imports affecting local industry. The investigation will evaluate the implications for pricing and market stability in the synthetic raw materials sector.

articles.title: RBI plans cooling-off for UCB directors
articles.summary: The Reserve Bank of India is proposing new guidelines for co-operative banking, mandating a three-year cooling-off period for urban co-operative bank directors after a decade of continuous service. During this time, directors can only be members or customers, though they may serve on other bank boards.

articles.title: IndusInd Bank plans bigger board for better governance
articles.summary: The bank is considering increasing its board strength to around a dozen members from the current nine with the aim of strengthening oversight and aligning with evolving regulatory expectations. Currently, managing director and CEO Rajiv Anand is the only executive on the board. Others are non-executive and independent directors.

articles.title: Of Modi government and its penchant for backronyms while naming its marquee schemes
articles.summary: The NDA government employs creative backronyms for its schemes like POSHAN, PM KISAN and PRASHAD, highlighting initiatives in nutrition, farmer welfare, and tourism. Here's a listicle of 12 such scheme names and what they expand into.

articles.summary: Goldman Sachs forecasts India's GDP growth to slow to 6.8 percent in FY27. Inflation is expected to rise, restricting the Reserve Bank's ability to lower interest rates. Private investment remains subdued. The rupee's depreciation is likely nearing its end. The current account deficit is projected at 1 percent in 2026. A US-India trade deal delay could pressure the currency.

articles.title: India’s capex revival: Manufacturing, new-age sectors lead as services, infra lag
articles.summary: Economists Teresa John of Nirmal Bang and Sameer Narang of ICICI Bank analyse India's evolving capital expenditure landscape. While private capex is reviving, it's driven by new sectors like renewables, electronics, and data centres, contrasting with previous cycles. Metals are expected to remain a dominant theme, while the government is likely to maintain its spending at 3% of GDP, with a potential focus on railways and defence in the upcoming budget.

articles.title: IDFC FIRST Bank introduces Zero-Forex Diamond Reserve Credit Card
articles.summary: IDFC FIRST Bank launches Zero-Forex Diamond Reserve Credit Card with zero forex markup, travel rewards, lounge access, insurance covers, and flexible redemption for frequent international travelers.

articles.title: Amazon Pay launches fixed deposits in India: How to open accounts and earn up to 8% interest
articles.summary: Amazon Pay launches Fixed Deposits in India via Shriram Finance, Bajaj Finance, and five banks, offering up to 8 percent interest and easy digital access for diverse customer segments.

articles.title: Behind derecognition of Vaishno Devi Medical College:Communal politics, protests and systemic failure, what 50 students will do now?
articles.summary: The NMC revoked recognition of Mata Vaishno Devi Medical College after severe faculty and infrastructure shortages, amid political protests, leaving 42 MBBS students uncertain about their future.

articles.title: Wrong side driving a BIG offence in Delhi now, 3 FIRs filed, check punishment, other details
articles.summary: Delhi imposed strictness on violating traffic rules. In a first such incident, the Delhi Police have filed three FIRs against offenders for driving on the wrong side of the road. This has come after such incidents have witnessed a massive increase.

articles.summary: The sex racket had been operating for the past three months.

articles.summary: BJP claims the locals in Bengaluru’s Kogilu who lost homes in a recent demolition are 'illegal migrants from Bangladesh'. They shouldn't be rehabilitated, according to the party.

articles.title: China reduced troops in Ladakh by half in last one year, says The Economist
articles.summary: Satellite imagery reviewed by Indian officials shows a tenfold increase in permanent Chinese structures since 2020, The Economist reports.

articles.title: Why court junked Punjab Police DIG’s bail plea, ruled ‘posting can’t determine CBI jurisdiction’
articles.summary: In Union Territories, CBI has full powers of local police, says Chandigarh special court, upholding suspended DIG Harcharan Singh Bhullar's October 2024 CBI arrest in Mohali.

articles.summary: The bench of Justices Aravind Kumar & N. V. Anjaria, however, grants bail with 12 conditions to Gulfisha Fatima, Meeran Haider, Shifa ur Rehman, Mohammad Saleem Khan & Shadab Ahmed.

articles.title: Why the real weight gain struggle begins before menopause
articles.summary: Most women expect the weight struggle to begin after menopause. But research suggests the real metabolic shift happens years earlier.

articles.title: Our ancestors never needed dental braces. Here is why
articles.summary: The image of ancient people sporting gold and catgut braces is certainly appealing and dramatic, but it doesn’t match the evidence.

articles.title: Cancel elections where candidates won unopposed, hold polls again in such wards: Uddhav to SEC

articles.summary: If the Bharatiya Janata Party starts making allegations, it would create serious difficulties for him (Pawar), Chavan said, and advised the NCP chief to "introspect" before levelling allegations.

articles.summary: Deepinder Goyal’s experimental wearable Temple, 'designed to measure blood flow to the brain,' sparked debate online and drew sharp criticism from a doctor-researcher of AIIMS Delhi.

articles.summary: Realme 16 Pro series will include two devices, the Realme 16 Pro 5G and Realme 16 Pro+ 5G.

articles.summary: Chinese foreign minister claimed Beijing was involved in mediating end to a number of conflicts in 2025. Over 81% of all Pakistani military hardware imported in last 5 years came from China.

articles.summary: Fauji Foundation is part of Pakistan’s broader military–corporate complex, where armed forces control significant economic assets to extend influence beyond defence and into the economy.

articles.summary: The main air-to-air weapon of the J-10s are PL-15 missiles, which were used by Pakistan during Operation Sindoor.
